data.text: To form or gather into a mass or whole.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To form into or merge with a corporate conglomerate.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To cause to form into a mass or whole.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A corporation made up of a number of different companies that operate in diversified fields.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A collected heterogeneous mass; a cluster.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a conglomerate of color, passion, and artistry.

data.text: A coarse-grained sedimentary rock consisting of rounded to subangular rock fragments cemented together by hardened silt, clay, calcium carbonate, or similar material.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Made up of loosely cemented heterogeneous material.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To gather into a ball or round body; collect into a round mass.
To bring together into a mass or heap; collect and form into a whole, without regard to congruity or homogeneity; form a conglomeration of.
